availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Organized at Camp Portsmouth, Ohio. Mustered in as the 117th Ohio Valley Infantry (U.S.A.) on September 16, 1862. Reorganized as the 1st Regiment Ohio Volunteers Heavy Artillery (U.S.A.) on August 12, 1863 in Covington and Newport, Kentucky. Mustered out on July 25, 1865. Commander(s): Colonel Chauncey D. Hawley and Lieutenant Colonel Fordyce M. Keith.

ab.bibl: Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, vol. 7, 1861-1866 (Cincinnati: The Ohio Valley Company), 257, 259.
